titlestmt.titleproper: ABC Television Network scripts and production files
Finding Aid for the ABC Television Network Scripts and Production Files PASC.0220

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-02 10:51:15 -0700.

did.unittitle: ABC Television Network scripts and production files
did.abstract: Collection consists of materials related to the production, promotion and/or programming activities of television shows aired on the American Broadcasting Company from approximately 1954-1974.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], ABC Television Network Scripts and Production Files (Collection PASC 220). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.
Processed by Julio Vera. Additions processed by Peggy Alexander, 2016.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials related to the production, promotion and/or programming activities of television shows aired by the American Broadcasting Company (ABC). The materials appear to have belonged to offices handling promotion and/or programming procedures at the network as described by Harold (Hal) Garb, a correspondent in the files. (Garb was not personally acquainted with the Walt Disney Production files, most of which date previous to his arrival.) The bulk of the collection dates from the 1956-1959 and 1962-1974. Included are scripts, programming and/or promotional information, and production information from a variety of television shows, such as Griff (1973-1974), The Streets of San Francisco (1972-1973), and Walt Disney Productions such as The Mickey Mouse Club (1954-1959). The production,cprograming, and promotional material may include network memos, cast sheets, shooting schedules, story outlines, photo shoot orders, development reports and biographical sketches. Additionally there is script material, including a script written by Rod Serling, for a series titled The New People (1968).

Walt Disney Productions files appear to have been generated by Walt Disney Productions and copied to the network. It is not clear what office at ABC (if any) these files came from. They form a self-contained unit of materials exclusively associated with Disney television productions, which happen to have aired on ABC.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
ABC TV Programing Files
ABC TV Promotional Files
Scripts and Production files
Walt Disney Productions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The ABC TV Programing Files include schedules, credit sheets, programing information, and development reports for television programs aired on ABC. Programming includes Movie of the Week, Mod Squad, Love American Style, Streets of San Francisco, and Griff among others. The series is arranged by television series title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the ABC TV Promotional Files include photo routing cards and a small amount of correspondence. The files are arranged by project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scripts and Production files consists of script material, outlines, and a small amount of production information. Programing includes Griff and Streets of San Francisco, among others. The series is arranged by television series title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Walt Disney Productions series appear to have been generated by Walt Disney Productions and copied to the network. It is not clear what office at ABC (if any) these files came from. They form a self-contained unit of materials exclusively associated with Disney television productions, which happen to have aired on ABC. The bulk of the series contains scripts and a small amount of production information. The series is arranged by project title.
